metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8629 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The xdr_nullstring function in lib/kadm5/kadm_rpc_xdr.c in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.13.4 and 1.14.x before 1.14.1 does not verify whether '\0' characters exist as expected, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted string. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled input strings. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service.

notes.Note: ratliff> use of kadmind by touch and core is not supported

criterions.comment: krb5 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
